article.headline: Richmond 60, Seton Hall 49
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Jermaine Bucknor and Kevin Steenberge each had a season-high 16 points to lead Richmond to a 60-49 win over Seton Hall on Thursday night. The Spiders (3-1) held Seton Hall without a field goal for the first 10:55 of the second half. Seton Hall (3-2) took its only lead when Brian Laing's jumper gave the Pirates a 17-16 lead with 6:57 left in the first half. Seton Hall missed five of its next seven field goals and had three turnovers as Richmond took a 26-21 halftime lead. Steenberge's six points keyed a 14-0 Richmond run opening the second half. The Spiders outscored Seton Hall 17-1 before Donald Copeland's layup with 9:05 remaining cut the Spiders' lead to 43-24. It was the first of 18 second-half points by Copeland. Copeland finished with a 22 points. The Spiders shot 43.5 percent for the game and held Seton Hall to 36.2 percent. The Pirates missed 16-23 second-half field-goal attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
